p: In the Old world, phleboviruses ( Bunyaviridae family, Phlebovirus genus) transmitted by phlebotomines consist of three species or antigenic groups, namely Sandfly fever Naples, Salehabad, and Sandfly fever Sicilian serocomplexes. Each species contains several viruses among which Naples, Sicilian and Toscana virus cause 3-day fever, commonly called sandfly fever in humans; Toscana virus (TOSV) causes of neuroinvasive human infections such as meningitis and encephalitis [ 1].
